issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description

When requiring a file if the file doesn't have a correct extension (.js, .json) then the file will not be able to be loaded. For example when having a file test.test and explicitly requiring 'test.test' I would expect (based off other platforms and node.js behaviour) there to be no error.

h5.Steps to reproduce

# Create a file under resources called {{test.test}} with the contents {{exports.foo = 'bar';}}
# Add {{alert(require('./test.test').foo);}} to your app.js

h5.Actual

Unable to find module

h5.Expected

An alert with 'foo' should show
fields.summary: Android: Unable to require a file without a correct extension

comments.body:
Apologies for missing your ping [~ybanev]
I guess not, I'd be fine closing this as wont fix, I can't remember why I filed it (I think something mocha-suite related), so it can't be that important :) But i'll let you, Gary, and Josh decided the fate :)
